description: From the Middle English halpeni, either from the late-Old English halpenige or from half +‎ peni; equivalent to half +‎ penny and continually reinforced by that surface analysis.

entries.meaning: (plural: halfpennies) (historical) A discontinued British coin worth half of one penny (old or new).
examples: If you haven't got a penny, / A ha'penny will do, / If you haven't got a ha'penny, / Then God bless you.

entries.meaning: (plural: halfpence) A quantity of money worth half a penny.
